recipe_name: Steak stuffed with Stilton and sweet potato ratatouille
author: Paul Rankin
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. To make the ratatouille, heat the oil in a pan and sauté the peppers and onion for a few minutes, to soften. Stir in the potato and heat for another 1-2 minutes. Transfer to the oven and roast for 10-12 minutes. For the steak, mix the chives, onion, parsley and Stilton together.  Make a slit along the steak to make a pocket. Stuff the mixture into the steak and then sear in a hot pan. Drizzle with oil and fry in a hot pan for two minutes on each side. Transfer to the oven and cook for 4-5 minutes, or according to personal taste. To serve, remove the roast vegetables from the oven and stir in the parsley. Transfer to a serving plate and serve the stuffed steak alongside.
ingredients: 1 tbsp chives, chopped,  ½ red onion, peeled and finely diced,  1 tbsp fresh parsley, chopped,  2 tbsp Stilton,  150g/5¼oz  sirloin steak,  1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ pepper, peeled and sliced,  ¼ red onion, peeled and diced,  ½ sweet potato, peeled, chopped and blanched,  2 tbsp parsley, chopped
